definition: to win instant success (idiom)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Cheng
meritorious deed or service/achievement/result/service/accomplishment/work (physics)

sentences.english: The courser in the picture means succeeding immediately upon its arrival.
sentences.chinese: 图中的骏马寓意着“马到成功”。

sentences.english: I wish you every success in the future.
sentences.chinese: 祝你将来事事马到成功。

sentences.english: May I wish you every success for the future?
sentences.chinese: 祝你前途无量马到成功。

definition: lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
the fabled roc flies ten thousand miles (idiom)/one's future prospects are brilliant
old but still full of vitality (idiom)
to have one's wishes come true/wish you the best!
to win top marks in the imperial examinations
to have all one's wishes (idiom)/best wishes/all the best/may all your hopes be fulfilled
to congratulate beforehand/to offer best wishes for
flood of good fortune fills the heavens (idiom); a lucky sign
everything is going smoothly (idiom)
bright future/bright prospects
to climb step by step/to rise steadily/on the up and up
to have a future full of promise
lit. plucking a branch of osmanthus from the Toad Palace (i.e. the moon)/fig. to succeed in the imperial examination
lit. dragon soaring and tiger leaping (idiom)/fig. prosperous and bustling/vigorous and active
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
lit. (may the) five blessings descend upon this home (namely: longevity, wealth, health, virtue, and a natural death)/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
